What the hell is going on in Aruba? The Aruban officials are dragging their feet, taking people into custody and then releasing them, not accepting or asking for help from the US FBI, not even really searching for this poor missing girl. Aruba is a tiny little island, a medium sized group of boy scouts could search it top to bottom in a couple days. 
 
 I am starting to think that the government is trying to downplay this incident in order to save their tourism industry. It seems to me that they are doing more damage by trying to cover this up. 
 
 Also, on the other hand, does anyone find it sickening that parents are allowing 17 and 18 y/o kids to go to Aruba basically without supervision? What is an 18y/o girl doing drinking at a bar at midnite in a small foreign country without supervision? Regardless of the outcome, her parents need to have their heads examined.

 Here, now you did say this, correct? 
 
 
Wednesday, June 15, 2005
 By Liza Porteus 
 
 NEW YORK - While Aruban authorities on Wednesday searched the home of a teenager who was one of the last people to see a Natalee Holloway (search), legal and investigative experts said the search, along with many other investigative techniques, could have been done long ago. 
 
 The investigation has "been severely compromised because what they're doing now they should have done two weeks ago," said forensic pathologist Michael Baden, who added that evidence could have been hidden or washed away within the past two weeks from the time the Alabama teen went missing and Wednesday's search.
 
 "The chances of finding anything significant has been greatly reduced by the two week's interval," he added.
